translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: اگر بخواهیم همواره خاشاکش می‌گردانیم، پس در افسوس (و تعجب) می‌افتید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We could turn it, if We pleased, into straw; then you would rue the day,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: If We will We can make it like dry trampled hay, so you would keep crying out.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Did We will, We would make it broken orts, and you would remain bitterly jesting --

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: If We willed, surely We would make it chaff, so that ye would be left wondering.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Were it Our Will, We could crumble it to dry pieces, and you would be regretful (or left in wonderment).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: If We will, We can turn it into rubble; then you will lament.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: If We so wished, We could have reduced your harvest to rubble, and you would have been left wonder-struck to exclaim:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Were it Our will, We could crumble it to dry pieces, and you would be Tafakkahun.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: If We willed, We verily could make it chaff, then would ye cease not to exclaim:

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: If We wish, We turn it into chaff, whereat you are left stunned [saying to yourselves,]

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: If We will, We would make it broken stubble and you would remain wondering,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: If We willed, We could make it [dry] debris, and you would remain in wonder,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Had We wanted, We could have crushed it to bits and you would have been left to lament,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: If We pleased, We should have certainly made it broken down into pieces, then would you begin to lament:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Law nashao lajaAAalnahu hutaman fathaltum tafakkahoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: If We so pleased, We could turn your harvest into chaff. Then you would start lamenting,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Were it Our Will, We could crumble it to dry powder, and ye would be left in wonderment,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [و می گویید:] مسلماً ما خسارت زده ایم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گويند: ما ثروت بر باد دادگانيم؛

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [و مى‌گفتيد:] واقعا ما زيان ديده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [و مى‌گوييد:] «واقعاً ما زيان زده‌ايم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (و گویید) که ما سخت در زیان و غرامت افتادیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (حیران و اندوهناک خواهید گفت:) ما واقعاً زیانمندیم! [[«مُغْرَمُونَ»: زیانباران. زیان دیدگان. از غرامت به معنی زیان و ضرر. هلاک شدگان. نابودشدگان. از ماده غرام به معنی هلاک.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [و گویید] ما غرامت دیدگانیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (بگونه‌ای که بگویید:) براستی ما زیان کرده‌ایم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که مائیم زیانکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [و گوييد:] راستى كه ما زيان كرده و تاوان زده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (و می‌گویید:) «همانا ما فریب‌خوردگان و زیان‌‌دید‌گانیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (And say:) "We have fallen into debt;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: That, “We have indeed been penalised!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'We are debt-loaded;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily we are undone.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Saying): "We are indeed Mughramun (i.e. ruined or lost the money without any profit, or punished by the loss of all that we spend for cultivation, etc.)! [See Tafsir Al-Qurtubi, Vol. 17, Page 219]

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “We are penalized.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: “We have been penalised;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (Saying:) "We are indeed Mughramun!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! we are laden with debt!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘Indeed we have suffered loss!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (Saying:) 'We are laden with debts!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Saying], "Indeed, we are [now] in debt;

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: crying, "We have been left to suffer loss.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely we are burdened with debt:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna lamughramoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "We are ruined,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Saying), "We are indeed left with debts (for nothing):

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بلکه ناکام و محرومیم

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما بى‌نصيب ماندگانيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بلكه ما [به كلى از رزق‌] محروم شده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بلكه ما محروم شدگانيم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بلکه به کلی محروم گردیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بلکه ما بکلّی بی‌نصیب و بی‌بهره (از رزق و روزی) هستیم! (آخر چیزی برای ما نمانده است و بی‌چیز و بیچاره شده‌ایم). [[«مَحْرُومُونَ»: محروم از رزق و روزی. بی‌بهره از همه چیز.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بلکه ما بی‌بهرگانیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بلکه ما بکلّی محرومیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بلکه مائیم ناکامان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بلكه ما بى‌بهره مانده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «بلکه ما محرومانیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Indeed, we have been deprived of the fruits of our labour."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “In fact, we were unfortunate!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: nay, we have been robbed!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Aye! we are deprived!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Nay, but we are deprived!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: No, we are being deprived.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: nay; we have been undone!”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Nay, but we are deprived!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, but we are deprived!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: No, we are deprived!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Rather, we have been prevented'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Rather, we have been deprived."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Surely, we have been deprived (of the benefits)".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay! we are deprived.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Bal nahnu mahroomoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: nay, we are deprived [altogether]."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Indeed are we shut out (of the fruits of our labour)"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به من خبر دهید آبی که می نوشید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا آبى را كه مى‌نوشيد ديده‌ايد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا آبى را كه مى‌نوشيد ديده‌ايد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا آبى را كه مى‌نوشيد ديده‌ايد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا آبی را که شما می‌نوشید متوجهید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا هیچ درباره‌ی آبی که می‌نوشید اندیشیده‌اید؟ [[«أَفَرَأَیْتُمْ»: (نگا: شعراء / 75، زمر / 38، نجم / 19).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا اندیشیده‌اید به آبی که می‌آشامید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا به آبی که می‌نوشید اندیشیده‌اید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا دیدید آبی را که نوشید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا آبى را كه مى‌آشاميد ديده‌ايد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا پس آبی را که می‌نوشید دیده‌اید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Consider the water that you drink.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So what is your opinion regarding the water that you drink?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Have you considered the water you drink?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Behold! - the water which ye drink:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Tell Me! The water that you drink.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Have you seen the water you drink?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Did you cast a good look at the water that you drink?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Do you not see the water that you drink.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Have ye observed the water which ye drink?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Have you considered the water that you drink?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Have you thought about the water you drink?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And have you seen the water that you drink?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Have you seen the water which you drink?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Have you considered the water which you drink?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Afaraaytumu almaa allathee tashraboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have you considered the water that you drink?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: See ye the water which ye drink?

verses.text: أَ أَنْتُمْ‌ أَنْزَلْتُمُوهُ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُزْنِ‌ أَمْ‌ نَحْنُ‌ الْمُنْزِلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا شما آن را از ابر باران زا فرود آورده اید یا ما فرود آورنده ایم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا شما آن را از ابر فرو مى‌فرستيد يا ما فرو فرستنده‌ايم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا شما آن را از ابر فرو فرستاده‌ايد يا ما فرو فرستنده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا شما آن را از [دل‌] ابر سپيد فرود آورده‌ايد، يا ما فرودآورنده‌ايم؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا شما آن آب را از ابر فرو ریختید یا ما نازل ساختیم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا شما آب را از ابر پائین می‌آورید، یا ما آن را فرود می‌آوریم؟ [[«اَنزَلْتُمُوهُ»: آن را نازل کرده‌اید و فرو بارانده‌اید. «الْمُزْنِ»: ابر.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا شما آن را از ابر فرو فرستاده‌اید یا ما فرو فرستنده‌ایم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا شما آن را از ابر نازل کرده‌اید یا ما نازل می‌کنیم؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا شما فرودش آوردید از ابر یا مائیم فرودآورندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا شما آن را از ابر فرو آورده‌ايد يا ما فروآرنده‌ايم؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا شما آن را از (دلِ) ابر آبستن به آب فرود آوردید، یا ما فرود آورندگانیم‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do you send it down from the clouds, or We send it down?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Is it you who caused it to descend from the cloud, or is it We Who cause it to descend?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Did you send it down from the clouds, or did We send it?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Send it down ye from the raincloud, or are We the Sender down?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Is it you who cause it from the rainclouds to come down, or are We the Causer of it to come down?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Is it you who sent it down from the clouds, or are We the Sender?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds or is it We Who brought it down?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Is it you who cause it to come down from Al-Muzn, or are We the Cause of it coming down

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Is it ye who shed it from the raincloud, or are We the Shedder?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Is it you who bring it down from the rain cloud, or is it We who bring [it] down?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Is it you that send it down from the clouds or We?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds, or is it We who bring it down?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Is it you who sent it down from the clouds or is it We who have sent it down?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Is it you that send it down from the clouds, or are We the senders?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Aantum anzaltumoohu mina almuzni am nahnu almunziloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Is it you who cause it to descend from the clouds, or do We?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Do ye bring it down (in rain) from the cloud or do We?

verses.text: لَوْ نَشَاءُ جَعَلْنَاهُ‌ أُجَاجاً فَلَوْ لاَ تَشْکُرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اگر بخواهیم آن را تلخ می گردانیم، پس چرا سپاس گزاری نمی کنید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر مى‌خواستيم آن را تلخ مى‌گردانيديم. پس چرا سپاس نمى‌گوييد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اگر مى‌خواستيم آن را تلخ مى‌گردانديم پس چرا شكر نمى‌كنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اگر بخواهيم آن را تلخ مى‌گردانيم، پس چرا سپاس نمى‌داريد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اگر می‌خواستیم آن آب را شور و تلخ می‌گردانیدیم، پس چرا شکرگزاری نمی‌کنید؟!

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر ما بخواهیم این آب (شیرین و گوارا) را تلخ و شور می‌گردانیم. پس چرا نباید سپاسگزاری کنید؟ [[«أُجَاجاً»: بسیار شور. تلخ (نگا: فرقان / 53، فاطر / 12).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اگر خواهیم آن را شور و تلخ گردانیم پس چرا سپاس نمی‌گزارید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هرگاه بخواهیم، این آب گوارا را تلخ و شور قرار می‌دهیم؛ پس چرا شکر نمی‌کنید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: اگر می‌خواستیم می‌گردانیدیمش تلخکام پس چرا سپاس نگزارید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اگر بخواهيم آن را تلخ و شور مى‌گردانيم پس چرا سپاس نمى‌گزاريد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: اگر بخواهیم آن را تلخ می‌گردانیم. پس چرا سپاس نمی‌دارید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We could make it brackish, if We pleased; so why do you not acknowledge thanks?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: If We will We can make it bitter, so why do you not give thanks?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Did We will, We would make it bitter; so why are you not thankful?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: If We willed, surely We would make it brackish. Wherefore give ye not thanks?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: If We willed, We verily could make it salt (and undrinkable), why then do you not give thanks (to Allah)?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: If We will, We can make it salty. Will you not be thankful?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: If We had so pleased, We could have made it bitter. So why would you not give thanks?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: If We willed, We verily could make it salty; why then do you not give thanks

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: If We willed We verily could make it bitter. Why then, give ye not thanks?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: If We wish We can make it bitter. Then why do you not give thanks?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: If We will, We would make it bitter, why then do you not give thanks?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: If We willed, We could make it bitter, so why are you not grateful?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Had We wanted, We could have made it salty. Why then do you not give thanks?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: If We pleased, We would have made it salty; why do you not then give thanks?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Law nashao jaAAalnahu ojajan falawla tashkuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: If We so pleased, We certainly could make it salty. Why, then, are you not grateful?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Were it Our Will, We could make it salt (and unpalatable): then why do ye not give thanks?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به من خبر دهید آتشی که می افروزید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا آن آتشى را كه مى‌افروزيد ديده‌ايد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا آن آتشى را كه بر مى‌افروزيد ديده‌ايد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا آن آتشى را كه برمى‌افروزيد ملاحظه كرده‌ايد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا آتشی که روشن می‌کنید می‌نگرید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا هیچ درباره‌ی آتشی که برمی‌افروزید، اندیشیده‌اید؟ [[«تُورُونَ»: روشن می‌کنید. برمی‌افروزید. از مصدر ایراء (نگا: عادیات / 2).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا اندیشیده‌اید به آتشی که می‌افروزید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا درباره آتشی که می‌افروزید فکر کرده‌اید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا دیدید آتشی را که افروزید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا آتشى را كه مى‌افروزيد ديده‌ايد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا پس آتشی را که بر می‌افروزید نگریسته‌اید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Consider the fire that you strike (and get by friction).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So what is your opinion regarding the fire which you kindle?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Have you considered the fire you kindle?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Behold! - the fire which ye strike out:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Tell Me! The fire which you kindle,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Have you seen the fire you kindle?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Did you consider the fire which you kindle?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Do you not see the fire which you kindle.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Have ye observed the fire which ye strike out;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Have you considered the fire that you kindle?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Have you thought about the fire you kindle?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And have you seen the fire that you ignite?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Have you seen the fire which you kindle?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Have you considered the fire which you strike?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Afaraaytumu alnnara allatee tooroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have you thought about the fire that you kindle.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: See ye the Fire which ye kindle?

verses.text: أَ أَنْتُمْ‌ أَنْشَأْتُمْ‌ شَجَرَتَهَا أَمْ‌ نَحْنُ‌ الْمُنْشِئُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا شما درختش را به وجود آورده اید یا ما به وجود آوردنده ایم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا درختش را شما آفريده‌ايد يا ما آفريننده‌ايم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا درختش را شما پديد آورده‌ايد يا ما پديد آورنده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا شما [چوب‌] درخت آن را پديدار كرده‌ايد، يا ما پديدآورنده‌ايم؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا شما درخت آن را آفریدید یا ما آفریدیم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا شما، در آغاز این آتش را پدیدار کرده‌اید، یا این که ما پدیدآورندگان آن هستیم؟ [[«شَجَرَتَهَا»: درخت آتش. مراد درخت مرخ و درخت عِقار است که به عنوان چوب آتش و چوب آتش گیره، آن دو را به هم می‌مالیدند و آتش تولید می‌گردید. یا این که مراد همه درختان است که حرارت و انرژی خورشید را در خود ذخیره می‌کنند و هنگام مالش آنها و یا سوختن آنها، حرارت و انرژی را آزاد می‌کنند (نگا: یس / 80). واژه (شَجَر) به معنی درخت و به معنی ذات و نفس، یعنی خود آتش نیز گرفته شده است (نگا: روح‌المعانی).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا شما درختش را آفریده‌اید یا ما آفریننده‌ایم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا شما درخت آن را آفریده‌اید یا ما آفریده‌ایم؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا شما پدید آوردید درختش را یا مائیم پدیدآرندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا درخت آن را شما پديد آورده‌ايد يا ما پديدآرنده‌ايم؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا شما درختش را - بی‌سابقه- پدیدار کردید یا ما پدید آورند‌گانیم؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Have you raised its tree, or We have raised it?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Is it you who grew its tree, or is it We Who create?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Did you make its timber to grow, or did We make it?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Produce ye the tree thereof, or are We the Producer?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Is it you who made the tree thereof to grow, or are We the Grower?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Is it you who produce its tree, or are We the Producer?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Did you make its tree grow or was it We Who made it grow?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Is it you who made the tree thereof to grow, or are We the Grower

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Was it ye who made the tree thereof to grow, or were We the grower?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Was it you who caused its tree to grow, or were We the grower?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Is it you that originated its tree, or are We the Originator?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Is it you who produced its tree, or are We the producer?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Is it you who have produced its tree or is it We who have produced it?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Is it you that produce the trees for it, or are We the producers?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Aantum anshatum shajarataha am nahnu almunshioona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Did you produce the tree that serves as fuel or do We?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Is it ye who grow the tree which feeds the fire, or do We grow it?

verses.text: نَحْنُ‌ جَعَلْنَاهَا تَذْکِرَةً وَ مَتَاعاً لِلْمُقْوِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ما آن را وسیله تذکر و مایه استفاده برای صحرانشینان و بیابانگردان قرار داده ایم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما آن را هشدارى و براى مسافران رهنورد، متاعى ساختيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ما آن را يادآورى [براى آتش قيامت‌] و كالايى براى مسافران [و جويندگان آتش‌] قرار داده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ما آن را [مايه‌] عبرت و [وسيله‌] استفاده براى بيابانگردان قرار داده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما آن را مایه پند و عبرت و توشه مسافران (کوه و بیابان عالم) گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما آن را وسیله‌ی یادآوری (قدرت خدا) و وسیله‌ی زندگی اقویاء و فقراء نموده‌ایم. [[«تَذْکِرَةً»: به یاد آوردن قدرت خدا. چرا که ذخیره کردن انرژیها در درختان و گیاهان و بازگرداندن انرژیها، دالّ بر قدرت خدا در میراندن مردمان و رستاخیز مردگان است. «الْمُقْوِینَ»: صحرانشینان. فقراء. ثروتمندان. بطور کلی استفاده‌کنندگان از آن (نگا: روح المعانی، صفوه التفاسیر، أضواء البیان).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ما آن را پندآموزی ساخته‌ایم و توشه‌ای برای رهروان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما آن را وسیله یادآوری (برای همگان) و وسیله زندگی برای مسافران قرار داده‌ایم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: ما گردانیدیمش یادآوری و بهره‌ای برای نیازمندان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: ما آن را يادكردى ساختيم- كه چون آن را ببينند آتش دوزخ را ياد كنند- و كالايى براى صحرانشينان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ما آن را یادواره و برخورداری برای نیازمندان- که نیروی زندگی‌بخش می‌خواهند- قرار دادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We have made it as a reminder and convenience for the needy.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We have made it as a reminder of hell and as a utility for travellers in the jungle.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We Ourselves made it for a reminder, and a boon to the desert-dwellers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: We! it is We Who made it a reminder and a provision Unto the campers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: We have made it a Reminder (for the Hell-fire, in the Hereafter); and an article of use for the travellers (and all the others, in this world).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We have made it a reminder, and a comfort for the users.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We made it a reminder and a provision for the needy.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: We have made it a Reminder, and an article of use for the Muqwin.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We, even We, appointed it a memorial and a comfort for the dwellers in the wilderness.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It was We who made it a reminder and a boon for the desert-dwellers.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We have made it a reminder, and a blessing to the traveler.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: We have made it a reminder and provision for the travelers,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is We who have made it as a reminder and a means of comfort for the people.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: We have made it a reminder and an advantage for the wayfarers of the desert.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Nahnu jaAAalnaha tathkiratan wamataAAan lilmuqweena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have made it to be a reminder and a benefit for the wayfarers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We have made it a memorial (of Our handiwork), and an article of comfort and convenience for the denizens of deserts.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس به نام پروردگار بزرگت تسبیح گوی.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به نام پروردگار بزرگ خود تسبيح گوى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس به نام پروردگار بزرگ خود تسبيح گوى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس به نام پروردگار بزرگت تسبيح گوى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس (ای رسول) به نام بزرگ خدای خود تسبیح گو.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: حال که چنین است، نام پروردگار بزرگوار خود را ورد زبان ساز (و سپاسگزار نعمتهای فراوان او باش، و به ستایش وی بپرداز). [[«سَبِّحْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّکَ»: پروردگار خود را بستای و بگو: سُبْحانَ مَنْ خَلَقَ هذِهِ الأشْیاءَ بِقُدْرَتِهِ، وَ سَخَّرَها لَنا بِحِکْمَتِهِ، سُبْحانَهُ ما أَعْظَمَ شَأْنَهُ، وَ أَکْبَرَ سُلْطانَهُ. نام پروردگار خود را ورد زبان ساز و یاد خدا کن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس به نام پروردگارت که بزرگ است تسبیح گوی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: حال که چنین است به نام پروردگار بزرگت تسبیح کن (و او را پاک و منزّه بشمار)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس تسبیح گوی به نام پروردگار بزرگ خویش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس نام پروردگار بزرگ خود را به پاكى ياد كن.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس به نام پروردگار بزرگت (او را) تنزیه کن.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So glorify your Lord, the most supreme.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) proclaim the Purity of the name of your Lord, the Greatest.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then magnify the Name of thy Lord, the All-mighty.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore hallow thou the name of thy Lord, the Mighty.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then glorify with praises the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So glorify the Name of your Great Lord.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Glorify, then, (O Prophet), the name of your Great Lord.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then glorify with praises the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therefor (O Muhammad), praise the name of thy Lord, the Tremendous.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So celebrate the Name of your Lord, the All-supreme.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then, exalt the Name of your Lord, the Great.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), glorify your Lord, the Great One.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore glorify the name of your Lord, the Great.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fasabbih biismi rabbika alAAatheemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Supreme.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then celebrate with praises the name of thy Lord, the Supreme!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس به جایگاه ستارگان سوگند می خورم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس سوگند به غروبگاه ستارگان.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس سوگند به جايگاه‌هاى ستارگان

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: نه [چنين است كه مى‌پنداريد]، سوگند به جايگاه‌هاى [ويژه و فواصل معيّن‌] ستارگان.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: سوگند به مواقع نزول ستارگان (یا آیات کریمه قرآن).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سوگند به جایگاههای ستاره‌ها، و محلّ طلوع و غروب آنها! [[«لآ أُقْسِمُ»: سوگند به. حرف (لا) در قسمهای قرآنی زائد و برای تأکید است (نگا: حاقه / 38، معارج / 40، قیامت / 1 و 2، تکویر / 15، انشقاِ / 16، بلد / 1). چرا که خدا در آیه بعدی آن را قسم یادکردن قلمداد فرموده است، و در کلام عرب (لا) زائد برای تأکید و تقویت کلام، فراوان است. از جمله: تَذَکَّرْتُ لَیْلی، فَاعْتَرَتْنی صَبابَةٌ وَ کادَ نِیاطُ الْقَلْبِ (لایَتَقَطَّعُ) (لا وَ أَبیکِ) ابْنَةَ الْعامِرِیِّ لایَدَّعِی الْقَوْمُ أَنِّی‌أَفِرُّ دیگر این که به اغلب این چیزهائی که همراه (لا) مقسمٌ‌علیه قرار گرفته‌اند، در جاهای دیگر قرآن بدون (لا) بدانها سوگند یاد شده است (نگا: نجم / 1، شمس / 7، مریم / 68، مدثر / 33، تکویر / 17، فجر / 2 و 4، لیل / 1، تین / 3). «مَوَاقِعِ»: جمع مَوْقِع، جایگاهها و مسیرها و مدارهای ستارگان. ستارگان آسمان بیشمارند و از جمله تنها در کهکشان ما حدود یک‌هزار میلیون ستاره وجود دارد، و نظام مدارات هریک از آنها به قدری دقیق و حساب شده است که انسان را به شگفتی وامی‌دارند. مسیر و مدار و فاصله آنها از یکدیگر طبق قانون جاذبه و دافعه تعیین، و سرعت سیر هر کدام با برنامه معینی انجام می‌پذیرد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سوگند می‌خورم به منزلگاههای ستارگان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سوگند به جایگاه ستارگان (و محل طلوع و غروب آنها)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس سوگند نخورم به فرودگاه‌های ستارگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس سوگند به فروشدنگاه- يا جايگاه- ستارگان

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس به فرودگاه‌های ستارگان [:دل‌‌های فروزان پیمبران] سوگند نمی‌خورم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So I call the placement of the stars to witness --

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So I swear by the setting places of the stars.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: No! I swear by the fallings of the stars

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: I swear by the setting of the stars -

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So I swear by Mawaqi (setting or the mansions, etc.) of the stars (they traverse).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: I swear by the locations of the stars.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: No! I swear by the positions of the stars –

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Fala! I swear by the Mawaqi` of the stars.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, I swear by the places of the stars -

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: I swear by the places where the stars set!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: I swear by the fallings of the stars

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then I swear by the setting of the stars,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: I do not need to swear by the setting of the stars

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But nay! I swear by the falling of stars;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fala oqsimu bimawaqiAAi alnnujoomi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Nay, I swear by the setting of the stars --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Furthermore I call to witness the setting of the Stars,-

verses.text: وَ إِنَّهُ‌ لَقَسَمٌ‌ لَوْ تَعْلَمُونَ‌ عَظِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اگر بدانید بی تردید این سوگندی بس بزرگ است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اين سوگندى است -اگر بدانيد- بزرگ.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و البته اگر مى‌دانستيد، اين سوگندى بزرگ است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اگر بدانيد، آن سوگندى سخت بزرگ است!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و این سوگند اگر بدانید بسی سوگند بزرگی است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و این قطعاً سوگند بسیار بزرگی است، اگر (درباره‌ی مفهوم آن بیندیشید، و از علم نجوم و ستاره‌شناسی، چیزی) بدانید. [[«لَوْ تَعْلَمُونَ»: این بخش از آیه، اشاره دارد به این که: در پرتو علم و دانش و اکتشافات بیشتر، ارزش این سوگند روشن می‌گردد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آن اگر بدانید سوگندی عظیم است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و این سوگندی است بسیار بزرگ، اگر بدانید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا آن است سوگندی اگر بدانید گران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همانا اين سوگندى است بزرگ، اگر بدانيد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اگر بدانید، آن سوگندی سخت بزرگ است!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And this surely is great evidence if you can understand --

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And that is indeed a tremendous oath, if you understand.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: (and that is indeed a mighty oath, did you but know it)

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily that is a mighty oath, if ye but knew!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, that is indeed a great oath, if you but know.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is an oath, if you only knew, that is tremendous.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and this is indeed a mighty oath, if only you knew –

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily that is indeed a great oath, if you but know.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! that verily is a tremendous oath, if ye but knew -

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And indeed it is a great oath, should you know.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and that is a mighty oath, if you but knew

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, it is an oath - if you could know - [most] great.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: - which is indeed a great oath if only you knew it -

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely it is a very great oath if you only knew;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainnahu laqasamun law taAAlamoona AAatheemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and, indeed, that is a most mighty oath, if you only knew --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And that is indeed a mighty adjuration if ye but knew,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که یقیناً این قرآن، قرآنی است ارجمند و باارزش؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه، اين قرآنى است گرامى‌قدر،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: قطعا اين قرآنى كريم است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه اين [پيام‌] قطعاً قرآنى است ارجمند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که این قرآن کتابی بسیار بزرگوار و سودمند و گرامی است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هر آینه این (چیزی را که محمّد با خود آورده است) قرآن گرانقدر و ارزشمند است. [[«إِنَّهُ»: این که قرآن که مقسم‌علیه است. «کَرِیمٌ»: گرانقدر. ارزشمند. یعنی قرآن کلام انسان نبوده و بلکه کلام یزدان است. نه شعر است و نه سحر است و نه غیبگوئی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آن قرآنی کریم است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که آن، قرآن کریمی است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا آن است قرآنی گرامی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه هر آينه اين قرآنى است گرامى و ارجمند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: همانا این (پیام وحیانی) همواره قرآنی دارای برکاتی همگانی است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That this is indeed the glorious Qur'an

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: This is indeed the noble Qur’an.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: it is surely a noble Koran

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: That it is a Recitation honourable.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: That (this) is indeed an honourable recital (the Noble Quran).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is a noble Quran.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: that this indeed is a noble Qur'an,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: That (this) is indeed an honorable recitation.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: That (this) is indeed a noble Qur'an

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: This is indeed a noble Quran,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: it is indeed a Glorious Koran,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, it is a noble Qur'an

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: that this is an honorable Quran

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Most surely it is an honored Quran,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innahu laquranun kareemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: that this is indeed a noble Quran,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: That this is indeed a qur'an Most Honourable,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [که] در کتابی مصون از هر گونه تحریف و دگرگونی [به نام لوح محفوظ جای دارد.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در كتابى مكنون.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه در كتابى مستور [لوحى محفوظ] جاى دارد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در كتابى نهفته،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که در لوح محفوظ سرّ حق مقام دارد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در کتابی پنهان (از دیدگان و دور از دسترس شیطان، که لوح محفوظ است) قرار دارد. [[«مَکْنُونٍ»: پنهان. گرانقدر و ارزشمند. دور از دسترس شیطان (نگا: شعراء / 210 - 212). مراد لوح محفوظ است. برخی چنین کتابی را قرآن می‌دانند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در کتابی نهفته‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که در کتاب محفوظی جای دارد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: در نامه‌ای پوشیده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در كتابى پوشيده و نگاه‌داشته- لوح محفوظ-

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: در کتابی (از دستبرد) نگهبانی شده.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (Inscribed) in the well-kept Book.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Kept in a secure Book.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: in a hidden Book

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: In a Book Hidden.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: In a Book well-guarded (with Allah in the heaven i.e. Al-Lauh Al-Mahfuz).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: In a well-protected Book.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: inscribed in a well-guarded Book,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: In a Book Maknun.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: In a Book kept hidden

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: in a guarded Book

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: in a Book protected (from tampering)

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: In a Register well-protected;

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: preserved in a hidden Book which

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: In a book that is protected

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fee kitabin maknoonin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: in a well-guarded preserved Book,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: In Book well-guarded,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: جز پاک شدگان [از هر نوع آلودگی] به [حقایق و اسرار و لطایف] آن دسترسی ندارند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه جز پاكان دست بر آن نزنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه جز پاكان بر آن دست نيازند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه جز پاك‌شدگان بر آن دست ندارند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که جز دست پاکان (و فهم خاصّان) بدان نرسد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: جز پاکان (یعنی فرشتگان یزدان) بدان دسترسی ندارند. [[«لا یَمَسُّهُ»: به آن دسترسی ندارند. از آن اطلاع پیدا نمی‌کنند. نباید به آن دست بزنند. «الْمُطَهَّرُونَ»: پاکان. مراد فرشتگان الهی است که آیات قرآن را به دست انسانها می‌رسانند (نگا: عبس / 11 - 16). یا مراد افراد متقی است که دل خود را پاک و آماده دریافت قرآن می‌دارند و چنین پاکانی از قرآن بهره می‌برند و آن را فهم می‌کنند. و یا این که مراد کسانی است که جُنُب نباشند و وضو هم داشته باشند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: جز پاکیزگان به آن دسترس ندارند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و جز پاکان نمی‌توانند به آن دست زنند [= دست یابند].

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: دست بدان نسایند جز پاک‌شدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه جز پاك‌شدگان و پاكيزگان به آن دست نمى‌رسانند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: که جز پاک‌شدگان بدان دست نیازند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Only they can reach it who are clean (of mind).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: None may touch it, except with ablution.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: none but the purified shall touch,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Which none can touch except the purified.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Which (that Book with Allah) none can touch but the purified (i.e. the angels).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: None can grasp it except the purified.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: which none but the pure may touch;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Which none touches but the pure ones.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Which none toucheth save the purified,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —no one touches it except the pure ones—

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: which none shall touch except the purified;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: None touch it except the purified.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: no one can touch it except the purified ones.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: None shall touch it save the purified ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: La yamassuhu illa almutahharoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: which none can touch except the purified.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Which none shall touch but those who are clean:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: نازل شده از سوی پروردگار جهانیان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نازل شده از جانب پروردگار جهانيان است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: نازل شده‌اى از جانب پروردگار جهانيان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: وحيى است از جانب پروردگار جهانيان.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تنزیلی از پروردگار عالم است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از سوی پروردگار جهانیان نازل شده است. [[«تَنزِیلٌ ...»: (نگا: شعراء / 192، سجده / 2، یس / 5).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: فرو فرستاده‌ای از سوی پروردگار جهانیان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آن از سوی پروردگار عالمیان نازل شده؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: فرستادنی از پروردگار جهانیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: فروفرستاده‌اى است از پروردگار جهانيان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: فرود آمده‌ای است تدریجی از جانب پروردگار جهانیان.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It has been revealed by the Lord of all the worlds.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Sent down by the Lord Of The Creation.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: a sending down from the Lord of all Being.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: A Revelation (this Quran) from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: A revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: a revelation from the Lord of the Universe.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: A revelation from the Lord of all that exists.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: A revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: sent down gradually from the Lord of all the worlds.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: a sending down from the Lord of all the Worlds.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (This Quran) is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: A revelation by the Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Tanzeelun min rabbi alAAalameena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It is a revelation sent down from the Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: A Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا شما نسبت به این گفتار سهل انگاری می کنید [و آن را قابل اعتنا نمی دانید؟!]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا اين سخن را دروغ مى‌انگاريد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس آيا شما اين سخن را سبك مى‌گيريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا شما اين سخن را سبك [و سست‌] مى‌گيريد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا با این سخن (آسمانی) باز انکار و نفاق می‌ورزید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا نسبت به این کلام (یزدان، یعنی قرآن) سستی و سهل‌انگاری می‌کنید (و آن را جدّی نمی‌گیرید؟) [[«هذَا الْحَدِیثِ»: این سخن. قرآن. «مُدْهِنُونَ»: جمع مُدْهِن، سهل‌انگار و بی‌توجه. سازشکار. با توجه به مفهوم اخیر، معنی چنین می‌شود: آیا با کافران و منافقان بر سر این قرآن سازش می‌کنید و همچون ایشان بدان کفر می‌ورزید؟! (نگا: قلم / 9).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا شما در کار این سخن سستی می‌ورزید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا این سخن را [= این قرآن را با اوصافی که گفته شد] سست و کوچک می‌شمرید،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس آیا بدین داستان شمائید چاپلوسان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس آيا به اين سخن بى‌اعتنايى و سهل‌انگارى مى‌كنيد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا شما این گفتار نوین را سبک‌گیرندگانید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then why do you dissimulate this Revelation?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So is this the matter regarding which you laze?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, do you hold this discourse in disdain,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Is it this discourse that ye hold lightly?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Is it such a talk (this Quran) that you (disbelievers) deny?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Is it this discourse that you take so lightly?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do you, then, take this discourse in light esteem,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Is it such a talk that you are Mudhinun

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Is it this Statement that ye scorn,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: What! Do you take lightly this discourse?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What, do you hold this discourse in disdain,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then is it to this statement that you are indifferent

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Would you say that this statement is a lie?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Do you then hold this announcement in contempt?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Afabihatha alhadeethi antum mudhinoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: How can you regard this discourse with disdain?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Is it such a Message that ye would hold in light esteem?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و فقط نصیب خود را این قرار می دهید که آن را انکار کنید؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و نصيب خود را در دروغ انگاشتن آن قرار مى‌دهيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و نصيب خود را اين قرار مى‌دهيد كه آن را تكذيب كنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و تنها نصيب خود را در تكذيب [آن‌] قرار مى‌دهيد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و بهره خود را تکذیب آن قرار می‌دهید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و آیا بهره‌ی خود را از قرآن تنها تکذیب بدان می‌کنید؟! [[«رِزْقَ»: بهره. قسمت. «أَنَّکُمْ تُکَذِّبُونَ»: مفعول دوم (تَجْعَلُونَ) است. برخی (رِزْقَ) را شکر معنی کرده‌اند و در این صورت مفهوم آیه چنین است: آیا بجای سپاسگزاری نعمت قرآن، آن را تکذیب می‌کنید؟! بعضی هم مضافی را مقدر می‌دانند که شکر است و آیه را چنین معنی می‌کنند: آیا شکر نعمت قرآن را تکذیب آن می‌نمائید؟! برخی هم رزق را فقط نعمت قرآن نمی‌دانند، بلکه همه نعمتها و روزیها می‌شمارند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و سپاس روزیتان را چنان کرده‌اید که [آن را] انکار می‌کنید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و به جای شکر روزیهایی که به شما داده شده آن را تکذیب می‌کنید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و قرار دهید روزی خود را که تکذیب کنید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و روزى- بهره- خود را [از آن‌] اين مى‌سازيد كه [آن را] دروغ انگاريد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و تنها نصیب خودتان را همواره در تکذیب (آن) قرار می‌دهید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: You live by calling it a lie.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And you make its denial your share?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and do you make it your living to cry lies?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And make it your provision that ye should belie it?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And instead (of thanking Allah) for the provision He gives you, on the contrary, you deny Him (by disbelief)!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And you make it your livelihood to deny it?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and your portion in it is simply that you denounce it as false?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And you make your provision your denial!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And make denial thereof your livelihood?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And make your denial of it your vocation?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: do you make it your provision to belie it?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And make [the thanks for] your provision that you deny [the Provider]?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Would you reject the sustenance that you receive rather than give thanks?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And to give (it) the lie you make your means of subsistence.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WatajAAaloona rizqakum annakum tukaththiboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do you make its denial your means of livelihood?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And have ye made it your livelihood that ye should declare it false?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس چرا هنگامی که روح به گلوگاه می رسد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس چرا آنگاه كه جان به گلوگاه رسد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس چرا وقتى كه [جان‌] به گلوگاه مى‌رسد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس چرا آنگاه كه [جان شما] به گلو مى‌رسد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس چرا هنگامی که جان کسی به گلو رسد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس چرا هنگامی که جان به گلوگاه می‌رسد، (توانائی بازگرداندن آن را ندارید؟!). [[«بَلَغَتْ»: فاعل آن (الروحُ) محذوف است و سیاق کلام دالّ بر آن است (نگا: قیامه / 26). «الْحُلْقُومَ»: گلوگاه. خشکنای. حلق. حنجره.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس چرا چون جان به گلوگاه رسد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس چرا هنگامی که جان به گلوگاه می‌رسد (توانایی بازگرداندن آن را ندارید)؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس چرا گاهی که رسد به گلوگاه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چرا چون [جان‌] به گلوگاه رسد- هنگام مرگ-،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چرا نه، آن‌گاه که (جانتان) به گلویتان رسد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then how is it that when the (dying) breath is withdrawn into the throat (and rattles),

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So why was it not, when the soul reaches up to the throat, –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Why, but when the soul leaps to the throat of the dying

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore then - when the soul cometh up to the wind-pipe -

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then why do you not (intervene) when (the soul of a dying person) reaches the throat?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So when it has reached the throat.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Why, then, when the soul leaps up to the throat,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then why do you not (intervene) when it reaches Al-Hulqum

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Why, then, when (the soul) cometh up to the throat (of the dying)

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So when it reaches the throat [of the dying person],

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Why, then, when the soul leaps up to the throat of the dying

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then why, when the soul at death reaches the throat

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Why can you not help a soul dying

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Why is it not then that when it (soul) comes up to the throat,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falawla itha balaghati alhulqooma

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Why, then, when the soul of the dying man reaches the throat,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then why do ye not (intervene) when (the soul of the dying man) reaches the throat,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و شما در آن وقت نظاره گر هستید [و هیچ کاری از شما ساخته نیست!]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و شما در اين هنگام مى‌نگريد، تكذيب نمى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و شما در آن هنگام [تنها] نظاره گريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در آن هنگام خود نظاره گريد -

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و شما وقت مرگ (بر بالین آن مرده حاضرید و او را) می‌نگرید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و شما در این حال می‌نگرید (و کاری از دستتان ساخته نیست). [[«أَنتُمْ»: شما اطرافیان شخص محتضر.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و شما در آن هنگام نظاره‌گرید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و شما در این حال نظاره می‌کنید (و کاری از دستتان ساخته نیست)؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و شمائید آن هنگام نگرانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و شما آن هنگام مى‌نگريد- به آن كه در حال جان‌دادن است-

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و حال آنکه- در این هنگام- خود نظاره‌گرید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And you wait for the moment (of death),

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Whereas you watch at that moment!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and that hour you are watching

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And ye are then looking on.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And you at the moment are looking on,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: As you are looking on.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: the while you are helplessly watching that he is on the verge of death,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And you at the moment are looking,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And ye are at that moment looking

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and at that moment you are looking on [at his bedside]

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and you are watching at that time

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And you are at that time looking on -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: right before your very eyes?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And you at that time look on--

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waantum heenaithin tanthuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and you are [at that moment] looking on [helplessly] --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And ye the while (sit) looking on,-

verses.text: وَ نَحْنُ‌ أَقْرَبُ‌ إِلَيْهِ‌ مِنْکُمْ‌ وَ لٰکِنْ‌ لاَ تُبْصِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما به او از شما نزدیک تریم، ولی نمی بینید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما از شما به او نزديك‌تريم ولى شما نمى‌بينيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ما به آن [محتضر] از شما نزديك‌تريم و ليكن شما نمى‌بينيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و ما به آن [محتضر] از شما نزديكتريم ولى نمى‌بينيد-

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما به او از شما نزدیکتریم لیکن شما بصیرت ندارید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما به او نزدیکتریم از شما، ولیکن شما نمی‌بینید. [[«إِلَیْهِ»: به شخص محتضر.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ما به آن [جان شما] از شما نزدیکتریم ولی شما به چشم بصیرت نمی‌نگرید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما از شما به او نزدیکتریم ولی نمی‌بینید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و مائیم نزدیکتر بدو از شما و لیکن نبینید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در حالى كه ما به او از شما نزديكتريم، ولى شما نمى‌بينيد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و ما به آن (محتضر) از شما نزدیکتریم ولی نمی‌بینید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We are closer to him than you, even though you cannot see?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We are nearer to him than you are, but you cannot see.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: (And We are nigher him than you, but you do not see Us)

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We are nigher Unto him than ye are, but ye behold not-

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But We (i.e. Our angels who take the soul) are nearer to him than you, but you see not, [Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol. 27, Page 209]

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We are nearer to it than you are, but you do not see.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: – at that moment when We are closer to him than you, although you do not see (Us)

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But We are nearer to him than you, but you see not,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: - And We are nearer unto him than ye are, but ye see not -

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —and We are nearer to him than you are, though you do not perceive—

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We are nearer to him than you, but you do not see

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Our angels are nearer to him than you, but you do not see -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We are closer to him than you, but you cannot see.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We are nearer to it than you, but you do not see--

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wanahnu aqrabu ilayhi minkum walakin la tubsiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and We are nearer to him than you, although you cannot see Us --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But We are nearer to him than ye, and yet see not,-

verses.text: فَلَوْ لاَ إِنْ‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ غَيْرَ مَدِينِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [آری] پس چرا اگر شما پاداش داده نمی شوید [و به گمان خود قیامتی در کار نیست و شما را قدرتی بزرگ و فراتر است؟]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر قيامت را باور نداريد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس اگر شما مجازات شدنى نيستيد [و معادى در كار نيست‌]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس چرا، اگر شما بى‌جزا مى‌مانيد [و حساب و كتابى در كار نيست‌]،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس چرا اگر حیات به دست شما و طبیعت است و شما را آفریننده‌ای نیست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر شما مطیع فرمان (یزدان) نمی‌باشید. [[«غَیْرَ مَدِینِینَ»: افراد نافرمان. اشخاص بی‌سزا و جزا. با توجه به مفهوم دوم، معنی آیه چنین است: اگر شما هرگز در برابر اعمالتان جزا و سزا داده نمی‌شوید (پس روح را به قالب او برگردانید).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس چرا اگر شما جزا دادنی نیستید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اگر هرگز در برابر اعمالتان جزا داده نمی‌شوید،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس چرا اگر هستید شما ناکیفرشدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چرا اگر شما [برانگيختنى و] جزادادنى نيستيد- يعنى اگر رستاخيز را باور نداريد-،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چرا، نه اگر شما جزا نایافتگانید (و حساب و کتابی در کار نیست)،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then why, if you are not indebted (to Us for life),

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So why is it not, that if you are not to be repaid, –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: why, if you are not at Our disposal,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore then, if ye are not to be requited

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then why do you not, if you are exempt from the reckoning and recompense (punishment, etc.)

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: If you are not held to account.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: if you are not subject to anyone's authority,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then why do you not -- if you are not Madinin

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Why then, if ye are not in bondage (unto Us),

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: then why do you not restore it, if you are not subject

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: why then, if you are not revived,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then why do you not, if you are not to be recompensed,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: If you are true to your claim that there is no Day of Judgment,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then why is it not-- if you are not held under authority--

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falawla in kuntum ghayra madeeneena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: why, then, if you are not subject to Our command,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then why do ye not,- If you are exempt from (future) account,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آن [روح به گلوگاه رسیده] را [به بدن محتضر] برنمی گردانید، اگر [در ادعای خود] راستگویید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر راست مى‌گوييد، بازش گردانيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چرا او را بر نمى‌گردانيد اگر راست مى‌گوييد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اگر راست مى‌گوييد، [روح‌] را برنمى‌گردانيد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: روح را دوباره به بدن مرده باز نمی‌گردانید اگر راست می‌گویید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر راست می‌گوئید (که خودتان مقتدر و توانا هستید) روح را بازگردانید. [[«تَرْجِعُونَهَا»: روح را برگردانید و دوباره جان به کالبد محتضر بدمید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اگر راست می‌گویید چرا آن را باز نمی‌گردانید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس آن (روح) را بازگردانید اگر راست می‌گویید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بازش گردانید اگر هستید راستگویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: او را باز نمى‌گردانيد، اگر راست مى‌گوييد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: چرا اگر راست می‌گویید، روح را بر نمی‌گردانید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Can you not bring him back? (Answer) if you are truthful

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: That you bring it back, if you are truthful?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: do you not bring back his soul, if you speak truly?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Cause ye it not to return, if ye say sooth?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Bring back the soul (to its body), if you are truthful?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then bring it back, if you are truthful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: why are you then not able to bring them back to life if you are truthful?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Return the soul, if you are truthful

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Do ye not force it back, if ye are truthful?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [to Divine dispensation], if you are truthful?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: do you not restore his soul, if you are truthful?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Bring it back, if you should be truthful?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: why can you not bring it (the soul) back (to life)?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: That you send it (not) back-- if you are truthful?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: TarjiAAoonaha in kuntum sadiqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: do you not cause the soul to return to him if you are truthful in your claim?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Call back the soul, if ye are true (in the claim of independence)?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس اگر [جان به گلو رسیده] از مقربان باشد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما اگر از مقربان باشد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و امّا اگر [محتضر] از مقربان باشد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اما اگر [او] از مقربان باشد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس (بدانید آن که بمیرد) اگر از مقربان درگاه خداست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و امّا اگر (شخص محتضر) از زمره‌ی پیشگامان مقرّب باشد. [[«الْمُقَرَّبِینَ»: اشخاص مقرّب، همان پیشگامانند (نگا: واقعه / 10).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس آنگاه اگر از مقربان باشد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس اگر او از مقرّبان باشد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس اگر بود از مقرّبان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اما اگر از نزديك‌داشتگان- مقربان- باشد،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس اما اگر او از مقرّبان باشد،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then, if he is one of the honoured,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then if the dying one is of those having proximity, –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then, if he be of those brought nigh the Throne,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then if he be of the broughtnigh.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then, if he (the dying person) be of the Muqarrabun (those brought near to Allah),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But if he is one of those brought near.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So if he is one of those who are near-stationed (to Allah),

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then, if he be of the Muqarrabin,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thus if he is of those brought nigh,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then, if he be of those brought near,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: If he is among the near

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And if the deceased was of those brought near to Allah,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (If a dying soul) is of those near to God,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then if he is one of those drawn nigh (to Allah),

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faamma in kana mina almuqarrabeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But if he [the dying person] is one of those brought near to God,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Thus, then, if he be of those Nearest to Allah,

verses.text: فَرَوْحٌ‌ وَ رَيْحَانٌ‌ وَ جَنَّةُ نَعِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [در] راحت و آسایش و بهشت پرنعمت [خواهد بود.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: براى اوست آسايش و روزى و بهشت پرنعمت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آسايش و راحتى و بهشت پرنعمت [براى او] است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [در] آسايش و راحت و بهشت پر نعمت [خواهد بود].

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آنجا در آسایش و نعمت و بهشت ابدی است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: همین که مُرد، بهره‌ی او راحت و آسایش و گلهای خوشبو و بهشت پرنعمت است.
